attributes.action: Make it mandatory for everybody to learn CPR
attributes.additional_details: Because it could potentially save lives of so many people!
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for everybody to learn how to do CPR, kids and adults should know how to do it.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether adults learn CPR are a matter for individual adults, not the UK Government or Parliament.

How to administer CPR is already part of the health curriculum for secondary schools: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1090195/Relationships_Education_RSE_and_Health_Education.pdf

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund free CPR courses for all adults, but it would be up to individual adults whether to take this up.
